DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Adverse Event Seriousness Due to Congenital Anomaly
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._An indication or description that the seriousness of an adverse event was due to a congenital abnormality.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record whether the serious adverse event was associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AESCONG
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was the adverse event associa
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the adverse event associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the details regarding Serious AEs are collected in the clinical database, then it is recommended that a separate Yes/No variable be defined for each Serious AE type. Sponsors may only collect the AESER field because the individual serious adverse event types might be collected in a separate pharmacovigilance database and therefore are not collected in the clinical database. The sponsor should check if the regulatory agencies to which the data will be submitted require the collection of this data.
